thread.title_full: Clarkson women’s hockey favored to win ECAC title | College Sports | nny360.com

author: Staff report
title: Clarkson women’s hockey favored to win ECAC title | College Sports | nny360.com
text:
POTSDAM – The Clarkson University women’s hockey team, which advanced all the way to the NCAA Frozen Four in Durham, N.H., last season, has been selected the favorite to with the ECAC Hockey title for the 2024-25 season in preseason polling.
Clarkson last season went 18-3-1 in league player last season, finishing in second place. The Golden Knights advanced to the NCAA Tournament as a No. 4 seed and vaulted into the Frozen Four with a 3-2 victory over No. 5 Minnesota in the quarterfinals. The Golden Knights then fell to the top-seeded and eventual NCAA champion Ohio State Buckeyes, 4-1, in the semifinals.
Clarkson gained first-place in the poll with 113 overall points. Colgate, which finished first in the league in the regular season last year with an 18-4 mark, took second in the poll with 109 points. In a sign of the competition at the top in the league, both Clarkson and Colgate received six votes apiece as the anticipated top team.
Cornell follows closely behind with 103 points and two first-place votes. St. Lawrence is ranked fourth with 92 points and one first-place vote.
The remainder of the poll is Quinnipiac (82 points), Yale (69), Princeton (65), Brown (47), Rensselaer (35), Harvard (27), Dartmouth (23) and Union (18).
ECAC Hockey also announced its preseason all-league team and three Clarkson players made the squad with defender and two-time World Championship medalist Haley Winn as the only unanimous selection by the league’s coaches (11 total votes, coaches are not allowed to vote for their team’s players).
Winn, an All-ECAC second team selection last season, led Clarkson in assists with 29 and tied for the team lead with 39 points with Nicole Gosling.
Gosling, ECAC’s Defender of the Year and a member of the Team Canada gold-medal-winning team at the World Championships this year, also made the ECAC Preseason All-League team at defense.
Clarkson forward Anne Cherkowski rounds out the Golden Knights all-league selections. Cherkowski led Clarkson in goals with 15 last season. She also was an All-District selection while representing Canada in the Collegiate Series this year.
Other ECAC preseason picks are All-ECAC forward Abby Hustler of St. Lawrence, who led the Saints in goals (24) and assists (31) last season. Cornell forward Lily Delianedis is also on the first team. She recorded 34 points for the Big Red last year.
Colgate stalwart goalie Hannah Murphy also made the preseason squad. Murphy last season broke the Colgate record for career shutouts with 15. She’s a member of Canada’s National Women’s Development Team.
Johnson Newspapers 7.1
